Ittay Dror wrote:
> so let's take the case of the shopping cart. according to the above, 
> there shouldn't be any shopping cart resource. as a client, i just 
> browse a web site for items i want, then post them all, in one go, to 
> http://example.com/checkout. am i right?

A server could have a bunch of shopping carts.

It could know that certain authentication parameters (whether RFC2617 
username and username/realm/password hash, or whatever) is needed to 
access the cart.

It could know a lot of things about how that shopping cart relates to 
other resources.

None of these things require it to know anything about any state held in 
any webbrowser or other client.
